column2: The pesanervios - Workshop performance by Joan Morey
column3: What is a performance? How to prepare an art project in this format? What to consider before making a performance? Does the performance as any work of art? What are the documents, publications or traces from a performative work? Is there to be a performer for a performance? This workshop aims to answer these and other questions regarding public of the performace, financing, the space of representation, the figure of the performer, duration, serialization, image rights, the strategic plan and multiple practical aspects use performance as a means of artistic expression effectively. Besides being an artistic discipline the use, performance works often as an escape route for artistic practice in times of crisis. And we do not mean only the economic crisis but also the crisis of the artist in front of the art system, the crisis before the creation of objects and even the crisis of meaning production. The use of performance can be intercalated here as motor, language or field tests, and those who use it will have to adapt to your needs, overcome idioms that surround it and know if it is or not the appropriate means of artistic expression to carry out his creative work. + info

New edition of IntercambiART - Art Market Exchange in Barcelona IntercambiArt is aimed at artists, art collectors interested in buying art directly from the artists without intermediaries, and sponsors linked to art. A NauArt INTERCAMBIART we thought it is a good philosophy to apply to the sector before the current difficulty of artists to promote and sell art. The mission is to provide patronage and art exchange between members and the general public for contemporary art with artists to promote, facilitate access to useful services and other works of artists from different fields through the exchange. Each artist can participate with a maximum of 3 works. Registration is through a contribution of 10 € for those who get the first 10 points to open your account and IntercambiART exchange standards. More information: intercambiart@gmail.com With the collaboration of: MORITZ + info

Opening June 29 at 20h the exhibition "Art Street Riereta" - 3rd edition Free entrance with glass of champagne. Riereta Street, in the heart of Raval, is reputed to have been, throughout its existence, the Barcelona route with the highest concentration of artists ' studios. Today it remains a landmark of Art in Barcelona and so La Sala Phoenix-based street Riereta, organizes motivation of the Festival del Raval 2016 , recopilatoria sample of some of its artists. The works presented reflect the variety of styles, trends and methods of expression that came to be created in the urban space getting into a vast and complex artistic environment, to some extent. Among the artists who enlivened the street Riereta the memory of Joan Brull Vinyoles (1863-1912) pioneer painter, with workshop in Riereta 24. The exhibition will accompany this July with events and activities that help you understand the unique conditions remains street setting in other times gave the preference of a remarkable number of artists and art estimators. The street has its origins as a place of establishment of the first settlers of the Barcelona environment (7,000 years ago). During the nineteenth century became an important industrial center with a strong social base protest; The following years were constituted meeting spaces and cultural leisure among which we remember: CNT, PSUC, USOC, feminist bar La Sal, the Llantiol Theatre, Theatre Riereta. remember as anecdotal fact that there was such origin Catalan expression "this is can sixty". In recent decades the street has been suffering the most dramatic speculation but until now maintained as a reference point for the Culture of Barcelona. Artists confirmed: Albert Casals, Jorge Fabian Castillo, Ernesto Camacho Clavijo, Alejandro Crespo, Tony Fernandez, Jorda Ferre, Silvia Genki, Victor Gil Sierras, Lara Gombau Cano, Julio Gómez, Julia Grima, Fernando Ochoteco, Mercè Pla, Joaquim Riera, Mattia Russo. Art Street Riereta + info

This time we decided to make the opening at the time of vermouth. So I hope everyone s Saturday July 2 from 11:30 to take a well chilly Moritz while admiring the beautiful artwork that Laura Agustí has us prepared. What who is Laura? If you do not already know ( you should), here you present it : As if it were a book about the most amazing discoveries of Jacques Cousteau or the most important zoologists of the time, the artwork of Laura Agustí us back to those encyclopedic illustrations of yesteryear with precise strokes and rich in detail. Laura amazes us with this kind of return to the past but very unique way: it creates animal hybrids and mutations between humans and animals. Thus, some discoveries seals Laura who just need the name in Latin in the subpicture. From the cosmic and overwhelming darkness underwater up portraits of the highest catlike bourgeoisie, Laura takes us by the hand through a world in which the animal kingdom has taken over all and we can only glimpse the human by the costumes and the gadgets that have left in this world; a test of the ancient presence of being extinct is the man in this world. Laura spent four years working in an architectural firm after finishing Fine Arts and Interior Design. Now, at last it has turned in the illustration, provided with botany and zoology as an inspiration. His style is marked by the absence of color (only used punctually) and black lines set by varying the thickness of the stroke. Influenced by the antique prints and tattooists as Svetov or Annita Andrey Maslov, Laura has managed to appropriate a classical style and in a way known to all, and do something unique that makes up your brand and identity. [Lamono] + info

The Session Bowie Gavin Evans Photography Exhibition from 15 July until 1 September. Opening on Thursday , July 14, 2016. Photographer Gavin Evans is known for his uncompromising style of portraiture. A large number of celebrities like Juliette Binoche, Daniel Craig, Dusty Springfield, Morrissey, Nick Cave, Iggy Pop, Ozzy Osbourne, Björk and Terry Gilliam have passed before his lens. Evans has appeared in a lot of publications around the world including the New York Times and The Sunday Times Magazine. In 2015, the Edinburgh International Festival, the largest arts festival in the world, signed Evans to renew its visual image. The Session reflects poignantly the man behind the legend. Evans's ability to expose their subjects perfectly reflected in this earthly representation of Starman. The Session is a revealing portrait of an exposed, exuberant and contemplative Bowie. The images in this acclaimed photo shoot have been shown on the covers of top magazines and newspapers the world from the original commission in 1995 by Time Out Magazine. Pafforrd Steve's book, 'Bowie Style', the Christopher Sandford 'Loving the Alien', and written by David Buckley 'Strange Fascination: David Bowie: The Definitive Story' biography of Evans have images on its cover. Evans snapshots with Bowie only have been overcome (in copies and reproductions), for the cover photo of Aladdin Sane, photographer Duffy. What distinguishes Evans's photographs is his only connection between the artist and photographer. Of all the snapshots taken the artist during his career, one of Evans became the favorite of Bowie. Bowie asked that the picture, which showed him lost and vulnerable, and ilustrase the cover page of the book of the exhibition "Bowie Is", the Victoria and Albert Museum in London. The same photograph was hung in the singer 's office in Manhattan. The exhibition The Session, after passing through Berlin earlier this year, comes to Barcelona to show the public the July 14, 2016 until September 1, 2016, in the Espronceda Space. + Info

column2: Exhibition Lonely hearts - Mariana, to miserável & Júlio Dolbeth
column3: Opening: June 22, 20h Five years after his first exhibition together, Júlio Dolbeth and Mariana, to miserável, older and wiser, join again in Lonely hearts, an exhibition dedicated eaters ice cream, the having cold feet in winter, listening to sad music loop, which drown in their sorrows and all the people who have not given up the search for love. The two Portuguese illustrators join complaints for the third time in an exhibition that talks about love, or lack of it. After a thorough investigation into events of speed dating, blind dates, casual weddings of friends, Tinder and other applications, nights out, lasting relationships, fleeting relationships, family expectations wounds, romantic comedies, failed illusions, loving disasters, much trial and Error and loves seemingly forever ... have gathered enough material for their new project. + info

The Design Series Mallorquina presents a new product line design begins its journey with a limited number of seats designed by 10 illustrators. The Catalan brand continues to strengthen this initiative its link with the city supporting creativity and talent Made in Barcelona. In the first #designseriesbcn collection curated by the study ESIETE has enjoyed the participation of: Conrad Roset, Joana Santamans, Chamo San Miguel Bustos, Javier Royo, Lapin, Olga Capdevila, Júlia Solans, Sergio Mora and Antoni Socías. Each illustrator has created a unique design that exudes positivity and energy, something we all want to have in our home. Each artist has produced 100 limited edition cushions. In addition 25% of the profits to La Casa dels Xuklis will go because we are up pads cancer. The foundation is a place where children with cancer or long - term illnesses and their families may feel welcome and "at home" when they have been displaced from their places of origin for treatment. Free entry with confirmation. Please confirm before 18pm on Monday , 27 June: xarxes@lamallorquina.es + info

column2: ** V ** Exhibition of dynamite by Ladyfest2016
column3: ** V ** VIDEO PERFORMANCE AND FEMINIST ACTIVISM Group exhibition which will show a selection of video performance and video documented actions that reflect on the relationship we have with the body and the impact that the capitalist and patriarchal system will have on its significance and assessment. From the fine irony, exposure of privacy or collective actions and calls on the use of pornography, remprenem the slogan "the personal is political" to create a space to reflect on the need for us reapropiar- body, despatriarcalitzar relations, resignificar disease, collectivize care or diversify pleasure. The invited artists are: vvv vvv vvv Jenny Edbrooke Diana J. Torres Yolanda Dominguez vvv vvv vvv vvv vvv vvv Beatriz Pons Regueira vvv Opening the Salonnières included in the program Ladyfest2016 Saturday 25 14h to 18h.
